description: After applying the update KB-130.0.2849.46 to Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based), users may experience a resolution in issues related to potential arbitrary code execution that stemmed from insufficient data validation in the browser's devtools. Prior to the update, users might have noticed unusual behavior or errors when using certain interactive elements in Edge, potentially feeling at risk while browsing. Post-update, the users are expected to have a more secure browsing experience, with the browser no longer showing signs of vulnerability related to the addressed CVE-2024-9965. This update ensures that the latest version protects users from previously exploitable conditions, affirming the integrity of their browsing environment.
